import { FunctionComponent, useState } from "react"; import Navbar from "../components/navbar"; import Slider from "../components/slider"; import { Router, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import ProductTemplate from "../components/ProductTemplate"; type Product = { id: number; name: string; imageSrc: string; store: String, price: number, description: String }; // Define your product data here as an array const Products = [ { id: 1, name: "Boat Smartphones", imageSrc: "/61pbjsiyvel-12@2x.png", store: "Amazon", price: 15.99, description: "Description of Product 1", }, { id: 2, name: 'Product 2', imageSrc: '/product2-image.jpg', store: "Amazon", price: 19.99, description: "Description of Product 2", }, { id: 3, name: "Product 3", imageSrc: "/61pbjsiyvel-12@2x.png", store: "Amazon", price: 19.99, description: "Description of Product 3", }, { id: 3, name: "Product 3", imageSrc: "/61pbjsiyvel-12@2x.png", store: "Amazon", price: 19.99, description: "Description of Product 3", } ]; const Desktop1: FunctionComponent = () => { const navigate = useNavigate(); const [SelectedProduct, setSelectedProduct] = useState(null); // Specify the type for useState const handleProductClick = (product: Product) => { setSelectedProduct(product); navigate('/desktop-3',{ state: { product } }); // Redirect to /desktop-3 }; return (
handleProductClick(Products[1])} // Pass a specific product here />
